data.label: Pinecone
data.name: pinecone
data.description: Upsert embedded data and perform similarity or mmr search using Pinecone, a leading fully managed hosted vector database

inputParams.label: File Upload
inputParams.name: fileUpload
inputParams.description: Allow file upload on the chat

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
**File Upload**

This allows file upload on the chat. Uploaded files will be upserted on the fly to the vector store.

**Note:**
- You can only turn on file upload for one vector store at a time.
- At least one Document Loader node should be connected to the document input.
- Document Loader should be file types like PDF, DOCX, TXT, etc.

**How it works**
- Uploaded files will have the metadata updated with the chatId.
- This will allow the file to be associated with the chatId.
- When querying, metadata will be filtered by chatId to retrieve files associated with the chatId.

inputParams.label: Pinecone Text Key
inputParams.name: pineconeTextKey
inputParams.description: The key in the metadata for storing text. Default to `text`

inputParams.label: Top K
inputParams.name: topK
inputParams.description: Number of top results to fetch. Default to 4

inputParams.label: Fetch K (for MMR Search)
inputParams.name: fetchK
inputParams.description: Number of initial documents to fetch for MMR reranking. Default to 20. Used only when the search type is MMR

inputParams.label: Lambda (for MMR Search)
inputParams.name: lambda
inputParams.description: Number between 0 and 1 that determines the degree of diversity among the results, where 0 corresponds to maximum diversity and 1 to minimum diversity. Used only when the search type is MMR

inputAnchors.label: Record Manager
inputAnchors.name: recordManager
inputAnchors.description: Keep track of the record to prevent duplication

data.label: Recursive Character Text Splitter
data.name: recursiveCharacterTextSplitter
data.description:
Split documents recursively by different characters - starting with "

", then "
", then " "

inputParams.label: Chunk Size
inputParams.name: chunkSize
inputParams.description: Number of characters in each chunk. Default is 1000.

inputParams.label: Chunk Overlap
inputParams.name: chunkOverlap
inputParams.description: Number of characters to overlap between chunks. Default is 200.

inputParams.label: Custom Separators
inputParams.name: separators
inputParams.description: Array of custom separators to determine when to split the text, will override the default separators

outputAnchors.name: recursiveCharacterTextSplitter
outputAnchors.label: RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter
outputAnchors.description:
Split documents recursively by different characters - starting with "

", then "
", then " "

data.name: openAIEmbeddings
data.description: OpenAI API to generate embeddings for a given text

outputAnchors.name: openAIEmbeddings
outputAnchors.label: OpenAIEmbeddings
outputAnchors.description: OpenAI API to generate embeddings for a given text

data.label: Buffer Memory
data.name: bufferMemory
data.description: Retrieve chat messages stored in database

inputParams.label: Session Id
inputParams.name: sessionId
inputParams.description: If not specified, a random id will be used. Learn more

outputAnchors.name: bufferMemory
outputAnchors.label: BufferMemory
outputAnchors.description: Retrieve chat messages stored in database

data.label: Jina AI Rerank Retriever
data.name: JinaRerankRetriever
data.description: Jina AI Rerank indexes the documents from most to least semantically relevant to the query.

inputParams.label: Query
inputParams.name: query
inputParams.description: Query to retrieve documents from retriever. If not specified, user question will be used

inputParams.label: Top N
inputParams.name: topN
inputParams.description: Number of top results to fetch. Default to 4

options.name: document
options.label: Document
options.description: Array of document objects containing metadata and pageContent

options.name: text
options.label: Text
options.description: Concatenated string from pageContent of documents

data.label: ChatOpenAI
data.name: chatOpenAI
data.description: Wrapper around OpenAI large language models that use the Chat endpoint

inputParams.label: Strict Tool Calling
inputParams.name: strictToolCalling
inputParams.description: Whether the model supports the `strict` argument when passing in tools. If not specified, the `strict` argument will not be passed to OpenAI.

inputParams.label: Stop Sequence
inputParams.name: stopSequence
inputParams.description: List of stop words to use when generating. Use comma to separate multiple stop words.

inputParams.label: Allow Image Uploads
inputParams.name: allowImageUploads
inputParams.description: Allow image input. Refer to the docs for more details.

inputParams.label: Image Resolution
inputParams.description: This parameter controls the resolution in which the model views the image.
inputParams.name: imageResolution

inputParams.label: Reasoning
inputParams.description: Whether the model supports reasoning. Only applicable for reasoning models.
inputParams.name: reasoning

inputParams.label: Reasoning Effort
inputParams.description: Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models
inputParams.name: reasoningEffort

inputParams.label: Reasoning Summary
inputParams.description: A summary of the reasoning performed by the model. This can be useful for debugging and understanding the model's reasoning process
inputParams.name: reasoningSummary

outputAnchors.name: chatOpenAI
outputAnchors.label: ChatOpenAI
outputAnchors.description: Wrapper around OpenAI large language models that use the Chat endpoint

data.label: Retriever Tool
data.name: retrieverTool
data.description: Use a retriever as allowed tool for agent

inputParams.label: Retriever Description
inputParams.name: description
inputParams.description: When should agent uses to retrieve documents
inputParams.placeholder: Searches and returns documents regarding the state-of-the-union.

inputParams.label: Additional Metadata Filter
inputParams.name: retrieverToolMetadataFilter
inputParams.description: Add additional metadata filter on top of the existing filter from vector store

hint.label: What can you filter?
hint.value:
Add additional filters to vector store. You can also filter with flow config, including the current "state":
- `$flow.sessionId`
- `$flow.chatId`
- `$flow.chatflowId`
- `$flow.input`
- `$flow.state`

inputs.name: Financial_Documents_Search_basedon_10k
inputs.description: Use this tool ONLY for questions about General Motors (GM) or Tesla's 2023 financial data from their 10-K SEC filings. This includes: revenue, expenses, assets, liabilities, cash flow, earnings, debt, financial performance, board of directors, executive officers, corporate governance, and company leadership from their 2023 annual reports. DO NOT use for: current stock prices, recent news after 2023, or general company information outside the 10-K filings. If the question asks about 2023 financial statements, 10-K data, directors, or board members, USE THIS TOOL FIRST before considering web search.

outputAnchors.name: retrieverTool
outputAnchors.label: RetrieverTool
outputAnchors.description: Use a retriever as allowed tool for agent

data.label: Tool Agent
data.name: toolAgent
data.description: Agent that uses Function Calling to pick the tools and args to call

inputParams.label: System Message
inputParams.name: systemMessage
inputParams.default: You are a helpful AI assistant.
inputParams.description: If Chat Prompt Template is provided, this will be ignored

inputParams.label: Enable Detailed Streaming
inputParams.name: enableDetailedStreaming
inputParams.description: Stream detailed intermediate steps during agent execution

inputAnchors.label: Tool Calling Chat Model
inputAnchors.name: model
inputAnchors.description: Only compatible with models that are capable of function calling: ChatOpenAI, ChatMistral, ChatAnthropic, ChatGoogleGenerativeAI, ChatVertexAI, GroqChat

inputAnchors.label: Chat Prompt Template
inputAnchors.name: chatPromptTemplate
inputAnchors.description: Override existing prompt with Chat Prompt Template. Human Message must includes {input} variable

inputAnchors.label: Input Moderation
inputAnchors.description: Detect text that could generate harmful output and prevent it from being sent to the language model
inputAnchors.name: inputModeration

inputs.systemMessage:
You are an AI assistant that can do two main things:

1) Answer questions about GM and Tesla using their 10-K filings.
2) Find LinkedIn profiles for people using the Tavily web search tool.

TOOLS YOU HAVE

1) Financial_Documents_Search_basedon_10k (retriever)
   - Use this ONLY for questions that are clearly about GM or Tesla
     financial information or anything that comes from their 10-K filings.

2) Tavily API (web search)
   - Use this tool ONLY when the user asks about the open web, especially:
       • “Find the LinkedIn profile for [person] at [company].”
       • “Locate the LinkedIn URL of the CFO of [company].”
       • “Identify the LinkedIn page of [individual] associated with [organization].”

   - When doing a LinkedIn lookup, ALWAYS build a query like:
       "[person name] [role or company] LinkedIn site:linkedin.com/in"

   - After Tavily returns results, do the following:
       • Look through the results list.
       • Find the first URL that contains "linkedin.com/in".
       • Prefer results whose title or snippet mentions the requested
         person and company/role.
       • Use that URL as the LinkedIn profile link.

   - In your final answer:
       • State the person’s name, role, and company from the snippet.
       • Provide the LinkedIn profile URL you selected.
       • If more than one profile looks plausible, say which one you
         think is the best match and why.
       • If no suitable link is found, say:
           "I couldn’t find a reliable LinkedIn profile for this person."

ROUTING RULES

- If the question is about GM/Tesla financials or 10-K content → use the retriever.
- If the question asks for a LinkedIn profile, LinkedIn URL, or LinkedIn page → use Tavily.
- For simple conversational or reasoning questions that do not require
  external data, answer directly without calling any tool.

Never invent LinkedIn URLs. Only output URLs that come from the Tavily
search results, or clearly say that no reliable profile was found.

At the end of every answer, you must suggest 2 short, relevant follow-up questions
to the user, based on the topic you just answered.

Format them under a heading "You could also ask:" like this:

You could also ask:
1. <follow-up question 1>
2. <follow-up question 2>

Guidelines:
- For GM/Tesla 10-K or financial answers, suggest follow-ups that dig deeper
  into risks, trends, or comparisons (e.g., "How did this change vs 2022?",
  "What are the main risk factors mentioned?").
- For LinkedIn answers, suggest follow-ups such as exploring similar profiles,
  comparing roles, or checking company information (e.g., "Show me the LinkedIn
  profile of another executive at the same company", "What does this person's
  career path look like?").
- For general answers, suggest follow-ups that help the user explore more detail
  or related concepts.
- Make sure the follow-up questions are specific and useful, not generic like
  "Tell me more".

At the end of every answer, include a confidence score from 0% to 100%,
based on how certain you are in your answer.

Confidence scoring rules:
- If the tool (retriever or SerpAPI) returns a strong direct match, confidence should be high (85–100%).
- If results are indirect, incomplete, or partially matched, confidence should be moderate (50–80%).
- If the data is unclear, ambiguous, missing, or conflicting, confidence should be low (0–50%).
- Always output the score in this format:

Confidence: XX%

outputAnchors.name: toolAgent
outputAnchors.label: AgentExecutor
outputAnchors.description: Agent that uses Function Calling to pick the tools and args to call

data.label: File Loader
data.name: fileLoader
data.description: A generic file loader that can load different file types

inputParams.label: Pdf Usage
inputParams.name: usage
inputParams.description: Only when loading PDF files

inputParams.label: Use Legacy Build
inputParams.name: legacyBuild
inputParams.description: Use legacy build for PDF compatibility issues

inputParams.label: JSONL Pointer Extraction
inputParams.name: pointerName
inputParams.description: Only when loading JSONL files

inputParams.label: Additional Metadata
inputParams.name: metadata
inputParams.description: Additional metadata to be added to the extracted documents

inputParams.label: Omit Metadata Keys
inputParams.name: omitMetadataKeys
inputParams.description: Each document loader comes with a default set of metadata keys that are extracted from the document. You can use this field to omit some of the default metadata keys. The value should be a list of keys, seperated by comma. Use * to omit all metadata keys execept the ones you specify in the Additional Metadata field

outputAnchors.name: output
outputAnchors.label: Output
outputAnchors.description: Array of document objects containing metadata and pageContent

options.description: Array of document objects containing metadata and pageContent

data.label: Tavily API
data.name: tavilyAPI
data.description: Wrapper around TavilyAPI - A specialized search engine designed for LLMs and AI agents

inputParams.label: Topic
inputParams.name: topic
inputParams.description: The category of the search. News for real-time updates, general for broader searches

inputParams.label: Search Depth
inputParams.name: searchDepth
inputParams.description: The depth of the search. Advanced costs 2 API Credits, basic costs 1

inputParams.label: Chunks Per Source
inputParams.name: chunksPerSource
inputParams.description: Number of content chunks per source (1-3). Only for advanced search

inputParams.label: Max Results
inputParams.name: maxResults
inputParams.description: Maximum number of search results (0-20)

inputParams.label: Time Range
inputParams.name: timeRange
inputParams.description: Time range to filter results

inputParams.label: Days
inputParams.name: days
inputParams.description: Number of days back from current date (only for news topic)

inputParams.label: Include Answer
inputParams.name: includeAnswer
inputParams.description: Include an LLM-generated answer to the query

inputParams.label: Include Raw Content
inputParams.name: includeRawContent
inputParams.description: Include cleaned and parsed HTML content of each result

inputParams.label: Include Images
inputParams.name: includeImages
inputParams.description: Include image search results

inputParams.label: Include Image Descriptions
inputParams.name: includeImageDescriptions
inputParams.description: Include descriptive text for each image

inputParams.label: Include Domains
inputParams.name: includeDomains
inputParams.description: Comma-separated list of domains to include in results

inputParams.label: Exclude Domains
inputParams.name: excludeDomains
inputParams.description: Comma-separated list of domains to exclude from results

outputAnchors.name: tavilyAPI
outputAnchors.label: TavilyAPI
outputAnchors.description: Wrapper around TavilyAPI - A specialized search engine designed for LLMs and AI agents
